intro: Dioctis pensylvanica, commonly known as the Pennsylvania dioctide, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in woodlands and moist soils. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological niche.
